page.title: 02WILDLIFE IN RODHUISH.
page.content: The open countryside is full of many animals of all shapes and sizes. At different times of the year well known animals can be easily seen in the wild. The most common and easily spotted animals are rabbits, pheasants and magpies as well an endless variety of small birds. A patient watcher could spot and track deer, badgers and foxes. None of these are liked by the farmers as they come down from the hills and destroy crops or frighten small livestock. Both the deer and the fox are hunted across the Brendon Hills. Badgers are thought to live closer to the farms and the villages. They are suspected of spreading the rubbish from the black sacks before the dustmen collect them. On a sunny day a wide variety of butterflies can be seen drinking from the many wild flowers.
